content.text: Django Introduction
What is Django?
Django is a Python framework that makes it easier to create web sites using Python.
content.html: Django is a Python framework that makes it easier to create web sites using Python.

content.text: Django takes care of the difficult stuff so that you can concentrate on building your web applications.
content.html: Django takes care of the difficult stuff so that you can concentrate on building your web applications.

content.text: Django emphasizes reusability of components, also referred to as DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself), and comes with ready-to-use features like login system, database connection and CRUD operations (Create Read Update Delete).
content.html: Django emphasizes reusability of components, also referred to as DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself), and comes with ready-to-use features like login system, database connection and CRUD operations (Create Read Update Delete).

content.text: Django is especially helpful for database driven websites.
content.html: Django is especially helpful for database driven websites.

content.text: How does Django Work?
Django follows the MVT design pattern (Model View Template).
content.html: Django follows the MVT design pattern (Model View Template).

content.text: Model
The model provides data from the database.
content.html: The model provides data from the database.

content.text: In Django, the data is delivered as an Object Relational Mapping (ORM), which is a technique designed to make it easier to work with databases.
content.html: In Django, the data is delivered as an Object Relational Mapping (ORM), which is a technique designed to make it easier to work with databases.

content.text: The most common way to extract data from a database is SQL. One problem with SQL is that you have to have a pretty good understanding of the database structure to be able to work with it.
content.html: The most common way to extract data from a database is SQL. One problem with SQL is that you have to have a pretty good understanding of the database structure to be able to work with it.

content.text: Django, with ORM, makes it easier to communicate with the database, without having to write complex SQL statements.
content.html: Django, with ORM, makes it easier to communicate with the database, without having to write complex SQL statements.

content.text: The models are usually located in a file called models.py .
content.html: The models are usually located in a file called models.py.

content.text: View
A view is a function or method that takes http requests as arguments, imports the relevant model(s), and finds out what data to send to the template, and returns the final result.
content.html: A view is a function or method that takes http requests as arguments, imports the relevant model(s), and finds out what data to send to the template, and returns the final result.

content.text: The views are usually located in a file called views.py .
content.html: The views are usually located in a file called views.py.

content.text: Template
A template is a file where you describe how the result should be represented.
content.html: A template is a file where you describe how the result should be represented.

content.text: Templates are often .html files, with HTML code describing the layout of a web page, but it can also be in other file formats to present other results, but we will concentrate on .html files.
content.html: Templates are often .html files, with HTML code describing the layout of a web page, but it can also be in other file formats to present other results, but we will concentrate on .html files.

content.text: The templates of an application is located in a folder named templates .
content.html: The templates of an application is located in a folder named templates.

content.text: URLs
Django also provides a way to navigate around the different pages in a website.
content.html: Django also provides a way to navigate around the different pages in a website.

content.text: When a user requests a URL, Django decides which view it will send it to.
content.html: When a user requests a URL, Django decides which view it will send it to.

content.text: This is done in a file called urls.py .
content.html: This is done in a file called urls.py.

content.text: Django History
Django was invented by Lawrence Journal-World in 2003, to meet the short deadlines in the newspaper and at the same time meeting the demands of experienced web developers.
content.html: Django was invented by Lawrence Journal-World in 2003, to meet the short deadlines in the newspaper and at the same time meeting the demands of experienced web developers.

content.text: Initial release to the public was in July 2005.
